author: Special Correspondent
text:
A group of villagers from a few hamlets near Radhapuram submitted a petition to Collector M. Karunakaran on Monday appealing to him to remove encroachment made by a woman nutritious meal scheme organiser on a road used by the villagers for several decades.

The petitioner villagers from Pettaikulam, Kailasaperi, Mudavankulam and Rammathapuram, who submitted the petition to the Collector during the weekly grievance day meeting, said F. Poomagal of Rammathapuram had encroached upon a road, classified as ‘Mangammal Salai’ in the revenue records, connecting Kailaasaperi, a Dalit hamlet, with nearby villages.

Since the road, measuring about an acre, had been illegally occupied by Ms. Poomagal, Kailasaperi villagers could not reach the nearby villages via this road and had been forced to use a circuitous route.

“When the issue was taken up with the revenue officials, she, after injuring herself, filed a complaint with the police alleging that she was assaulted by those who alerted the officials about the encroachment. Consequently, the whistleblowers kept themselves away from this issue,” said Sivanantha Pandian, one of the petitioners.

The villagers said the illegal occupancy also had denied over 300 farmers their right to reach their farms via the ‘Mangammal Salai’ now under encroachment.

“The Collector should instruct the revenue officials to survey the stretch and render justice to the poor villagers,” said S. Suganthi, an advocate and one of the signatories of the petition.
title: Woman encroached upon road: villagers
